metadata.scope: Anantara Vacation Club - Club Services, Programs, Booking, Conversions

questions.question: What is the difference between Guest ID and Owner ID?
questions.answer: Guest ID is linked to a booking guest profile, while Owner ID is linked to the official ownership account and provides access to contracts, points, bookings, financial status, and case history.

questions.question: Which ID should agents use to view full ownership details?
questions.answer: Owner ID.

questions.question: What does a Cancelled booking status mean?
questions.answer: The booking is cancelled. Refund details are not shown in this status.

questions.question: What does Reserved booking status mean?
questions.answer: The booking is confirmed, even if check-in has not occurred.

questions.question: What does Modified booking status mean?
questions.answer: The booking was changed after confirmation and will not revert to Reserved.

questions.question: Who is considered a China-based owner?
questions.answer: An owner whose registered address country is China.

questions.question: Are non-China-based Elite owners allowed to access China Collection?
questions.answer: Only if they opt in and pay the annual access fee; otherwise, they can only access properties already in Club Programmes.

questions.question: What is the annual access fee for China Collection?
questions.answer: USD 700 or 3,900 Club Points per year (subject to change).

questions.question: Until when was the China Collection access fee waived for China-based owners?
questions.answer: From 2020 until the end of 2025.

questions.question: Where can China-based owners book China Collection properties?
questions.answer: Through the Owner Website.

questions.question: What is Club Getaways?
questions.answer: A trial program offering properties in locations without Minor Hotel Group presence or high-demand destinations.

questions.question: Which Elite tiers are eligible for Club Getaways?
questions.answer: Elite Ruby, Elite Diamond, Elite Platinum, and Elite Royal.

questions.question: Is there an access fee for Club Getaways?
questions.answer: Yes, except for Elite Royal which has free access.

questions.question: What is Global Traveller?
questions.answer: An international exchange program for Elite Points Owners to exchange holiday use rights for stays at exchange-affiliated resorts worldwide on a space-available basis.

questions.question: Which brands are included under Global Traveller?
questions.answer: Diamond Resorts, The Crane, and Club Med.

questions.question: Is there a cost between resorts under Global Traveller?
questions.answer: No, except for Club Med.

questions.question: What is RCI?
questions.answer: A timeshare exchange company with over 4,300 affiliated resorts in more than 100 countries.

questions.question: Do Elite Members receive RCI access?
questions.answer: Yes, RCI is a complimentary benefit for all Elite Members.

questions.question: What is the AVC to RCI conversion ratio?
questions.answer: 1 AVC Point equals 4 RCI Points.

questions.question: Who is eligible for Airline Points Conversion?
questions.answer: Elite Diamond owners and above, with some airline-specific exceptions.

questions.question: What is the minimum number of points per airline conversion?
questions.answer: 1,000 Club Points.

questions.question: How long does airline points conversion take?
questions.answer: Approximately 8 weeks.

questions.question: Can airline miles be converted back to AVC points?
questions.answer: No.

questions.question: What font and size must be used for Club Services emails?
questions.answer: Arial, size 14, black text only.

questions.question: What is the required Salesforce case subject format?
questions.answer: O#(Owner Number) – Case Topic.

questions.question: Should agents assign themselves as Case Respondent?
questions.answer: Yes, when taking ownership of the case.
